results.title: Genre
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A day in the life of a blocked screenwriter. A film producer is harassing a screenwriter who is suffering major problems trying to come up with a script for his next movie. This short film visually depicts the film scenarios this writer conjures up - a mystery and gangster style thriller. Neither of these stories satisfy the frustrated screenwriter, and so he ends up writing a simple love story between two ordinary people. Finally he finishes the script and rushes to the post box to send his script to the producer. Upon arriving at the letter box, he meets the woman of his dreams. His screenwriting dreams become a reality.

results.title: Directors of the future
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A ‘mokumentary’ following the trials and tribulations of future ‘Star Director’ Izabella Dazs’ career. We begin the film as she is formulating an idea for her film and we finish by seeing her end product, “Les pommes du mal”.

results.title: Cuttlefish dreams: Hyper parsnip bitches
results.brief_description: This high energy animation looks and feels like an arcade game experience. Jumping, kicking characters fight a gory path through a series of game worlds battling a series of ‘evil freaks’. And there’s cuttlefish

results.title: Firestorm
results.brief_description: In the aftermath of the fires that swept through Canberra in 2003, three teenagers contemplate their loss amongst the ashes and ruins of their suburbs. Exploring the impact of the devastation through their music, lives and loves, Firestorm is an intimate meditation on the fears, hopes and dreams of Australia’s largely unheard youth. Stylised images of the city combine with languid observations of the subjects to uncover the beauty that lies in the wake of the firestorm.

results.title: The Farm
results.brief_description: A photographic meditation on the family farm. This was 13 year old David’s first attempt to create anything using multimedia. It is a simple slideshow, but his presentation of his beloved family farm in all its moods reveals a connection to and feeling for place that is unmistakable.
results.description: A photographic meditation on the family farm. This was 13 year old David’s first attempt to create anything using multimedia. results.title: Thrownness
results.brief_description:
Two people are thrown into a strange, mysterious place where nothing is as it appears to be and where the relation between cause and effect is never stable. As they explore their surroundings they discover that space, time and themselves are elements of a carefully constructed illusion. Thrownness has been inspired by Matthew Arnold’s poem, ‘Dover Beach’ and philosopher Martin Heidegger. Arnold’s poem of 1867 has surprising contemporary relevance in a time where ‘ignorant armies clash by night’. The romantic photography reminiscent of 1950 Technicolor films, fantastical sets inspired by Fellini’s films and the use of old style in-camera effects create an intriguing, magical aesthetic.

As viewers Thrownness asks us to consider our role in creating narrative coherence through our understanding of cinematic traditions and visual language. The story has an integral, essential and evolving relationship with the elements that create it. The effect of this is the generation of an unexpected alternative narrative which reveals the complex artifice that is the film language.
